summary: This is a March 14, 2020 letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the case United States v. Tova Noel and Michael Thomas (No. 19 Cr. 830). It responds to discovery requests, providing specific video file references and timestamps related to surveillance of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 9-10, 2019, the period surrounding his death.

keyFacts: The document is a discovery response in the criminal case against MCC correctional officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas (19 Cr. 830).
It provides specific video file names and timestamps from MCC surveillance on August 9-10, 2019, detailing Jeffrey Epstein's movements and the defendants' activities.
Epstein is shown leaving his cell to make a phone call at approximately 18:53:54 on August 9 and being escorted back at approximately 19:49:25.
The government states it has not reviewed all surveillance of Epstein during his more than 30 days at the MCC, but provides specific clips as a courtesy.
The letter references a separate case, United States v. Tartaglione, and attaches public filings from it.
